alert.note: Alert for Decatur (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 04 at 9:26AM EST until January 04 at 12:00PM EST by NWS Tallahassee
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 AM EST FOR NORTHEASTERN DECATUR...SOUTHERN MILLER...SOUTHWESTERN MITCHELL... SOUTHWESTERN BAKER AND NORTHEASTERN SEMINOLE COUNTIES... At 925 AM EST, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Colquitt to 7 miles east of Donalsonville, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. Downed trees and powerlines were recently reported in Early County Georgia. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations impacted include... Colquitt, Donalsonville, Iron City, Brinson, Vada, Ausmac, Babcock, Hopeful, Eldorendo, Steinham Store, Boykin, Sharphagen, Enterprise and Bellview. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until noon EST for southwestern Georgia. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
